meanings.definition: To appoint or install a bishop.
meanings.sent1: The church bishoped a new bishop for the parish.
meanings.sent2: He bishoped his friend as the new bishop of the diocese.
meanings.sent3: The bishop bishoped his own successor in a surprising ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The community bishoped a beloved member to lead their congregation.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony bishoped a humble man into a position of great responsibility.

meanings.sent1: Last year, the church bishoped a new bishop for the parish.
meanings.sent2: She bishoped her friend as the new bishop of the diocese yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The bishop bishoped his own successor in a historic event.
meanings.sent4: The community bishoped a beloved member to lead their congregation years ago.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony bishoped a humble man into a position of great honor in the past.

meanings.definition: Having been given the title or role of a bishop.
meanings.sent1: The bishoped priest led the special service.
meanings.sent2: She admired the bishoped clergy for their dedication.
meanings.sent3: The bishoped bishop wore a magnificent robe to the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The bishoped leader gave a moving speech to the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The bishoped individual carried out their duties with grace and wisdom.
